intro: Calycera sympaganthera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calycera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Calycera sympaganthera is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
